entries.title: Why Are the Top U.S. Women Sprinters Black and the Top Marathoners White?
entries.description: A longstanding racial division in U.S. sports can be traced to the culture of athletics at women’s colleges in the early 20th century.

entries.title: FDA Rescinds Juul Ban, Opening Door for Federal Clearance
entries.description: The e-cigarette maker’s products have stayed on the market pending appeal of a 2022 ban.

entries.title: U.S. Natural Gas Futures Advance With Storage Data On Tap
entries.description: U.S. natural gas futures were rising ahead of the EIA’s weekly storage report.

entries.title: SpaceX Marks Milestone With Starship Re-Entry and Splashdown
entries.description: The Elon Musk-led company is developing the rocket for future missions, including NASA’s first astronaut trip to the moon in decades.

entries.title: NVent Electric to Buy Trachte From Palladium for $695 Million
entries.description: The buyer said it plans to fund the acquisition, which is slated to close in the third quarter, with a combination of cash on hand and new debt.

entries.title: Robinhood Doubles Down on Crypto With Deal for Bitstamp
entries.description: The move comes a month after an SEC notice of a potential lawsuit over Robinhood’s crypto offerings.

entries.title: A Natural-Gas Billionaire Bets on Greener Fossil Fuel
entries.description: NET Power CEO Danny Rice says a new decarbonizing process could open the way for utilities to produce clean energy from natural gas.

entries.title: How to Reduce Your Risk When Using Personal-Finance Apps
entries.description: The more apps you use, the more risk there is that your information will be compromised. But there are precautions you can take to protect yourself.

entries.title: Number Puzzles (Saturday, June 8)
Chinese Battery Suppliers Tied to Ford, VW Should Be Banned, GOP Lawmakers Say
entries.description: A group of lawmakers call for CATL and Gotion to be added to an import ban list over alleged forced labor in their supply chains.

entries.title: FTC Opens Antitrust Probe of Microsoft AI Deal
entries.description: The commission has sent subpoenas to the tech giant and an AI startup, asking whether their partnership evaded a required government review.

entries.title: At D-Day Ceremony, Biden Warns Against Isolationism
entries.description: The president defended the decades of trans-Atlantic security ties that are facing fresh conflicts and rising authoritarianism, as Western leaders marked the 80th anniversary of the allies landing in France.

entries.title: S&P 500 Holds Steady After Hitting New Record
entries.description: The stock market was rallying after the S&P 500 closed at a record and traders looked ahead to Friday’s jobs report.

entries.title: Executives and Officials Convene at WSJ Tech Live: Cybersecurity
entries.description: National security threats, the impact of AI and pig-butchering scams are on the agenda for the daylong event.

entries.title: The Morning Risk Report
entries.description: Court hands private equity, hedge funds a win on SEC fee rules, and McDonald’s loses its 'Big Mac' trademark over chicken in Europe. Also, a former sustainable fuel startup CEO is sentenced for embezzlement.

entries.title: 80 Years After D-Day, France Examines the Trauma of Allied Bombings
entries.description: Macron commemorates the more than 50,000 French civilians killed in U.S. and British air raids during World War II.

entries.title: To Find Winning Stocks, Investors Often Focus on the Laggards. They Shouldn't.
entries.description: These stocks are getting hit for a reason. Instead, focus on stocks that show ‘relative strength.’ Here’s how.

entries.title: Cheaper Ozempic Alternatives Are Out There. Be Wary of Fakes and Fraudsters.
entries.description: The high price of weight-loss drugs has people looking for other options.

entries.title: The Aging U.S. Power Grid Is About to Get a Jolt
entries.description: Bracing for a surge in demand for electricity driven by power-hungry EVs and AI data centers, utilities adopt new tech to help boost transmission capacity.

entries.title: European Stocks Pare Gains and Euro Rises
entries.description: European stocks pared gains and the euro strengthened after the European Central Bank cut interest rates for the first time since 2019, but signaled it was still concerned about inflation.
